intro: Polyscias schmidii, commonly known as the Schmid's glorybower, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by dark blue or black berries. Polyscias schmidii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
